definition: to warm oneself at a fire
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86

sentences.english: The best and most attractive among them are roast turkey and pumpkin pie.
sentences.chinese: 其中最妙和最吸引人的大菜是烤火鸡和番瓜馅饼。

sentences.english: Very good! You are so clever! The best one among them are roast turkey and pumpkin pie.
sentences.chinese: 其中最妙和最吸引人的大菜是烤火鸡和南瓜馅饼。

sentences.english: A few turkey facts to ponder as dinner roasts on Thursday.
sentences.chinese: 大家都在考虑将烤火鸡作为周四的晚餐。

sentences.english: The soft relaxation armchairs surround a huge fire timbale burning in the fireproofed hull of the vessel.
sentences.chinese: 柔软的休闲扶椅围绕着防火船身里一个巨大的烤火处。

sentences.english: Read the text first and then explain the new words.
sentences.chinese: 先让我烤烤火暖和一下，然后我们开始谈话。

sentences.english: They all moved towards the fire to get warm.
They broiled a turkey over charcoal.
Thanksgiving Day is very popular in western country, on that day, people will make a big turkey to eat.
sentences.chinese: 感恩节在西方很流行，在那天，人们烤火鸡来吃。

sentences.english: There he was toasting himself by the fire.
sentences.chinese: 他就在那儿，在火炉边烤火。

sentences.english: We stabbed at the roast turkey with our forks.
sentences.chinese: 我们的餐叉全都叉向烤火鸡。

sentences.english: Sit down, sir, and warm yourself.
She seemed to see that she was sitting by a large iron stove.
sentences.chinese: 这次她仿佛看到自己正在一个大铜炉边烤火。

sentences.english: The thing I enjoy most about England in the autumn is a log fire!
sentences.chinese: 在秋天，我最喜欢的英国东西就是用木材烤火取暖。

sentences.english: The bots will prepare a roast turkey dinner for you with all the trimmings.
sentences.chinese: 机器人会给你准备好一顿填料十足的烤火鸡宴。

sentences.english: The cost of roasting turkeys doesn't tend to follow actual wholesale prices but is often a loss leader.
sentences.chinese: 烤火鸡的费用并不跟随实际的批发价格走还经常亏本。

sentences.english: They had a traditional Thanksgiving dinner featuring roast turkey.
sentences.chinese: 他们吃了一顿以烤火鸡为特色的传统的感恩节晚餐。

definition: to warm oneself (by a fire etc)
to manufacture charcoal/to burn charcoal (often a reference to suicide by carbon monoxide poisoning)
to light a fire for cooking
to make a fire/to light a fire
